creator: tony.langan@rbos.com
text:
The setting up of a TRACE priority in XPriority.java and its implementation in
XCategory.java does not work when run by XTest passing in extension1.xml

Investigation shows that the call (in XCategory.java) to 
     XPriority.TRACE.isGreaterOrEqual(this.getChainedPriority())
is returning false as this.getChainedPriority() is returning Priority.DEBUG.

(N.B. in XPriority if 
  static final int  TRACE_INT   = Priority.DEBUG_INT - 1;
is changed to 
  static final int  TRACE_INT   = Priority.DEBUG_INT + 1;
then trace does appear in the Log.)
